As soon as Rodimus gave the word, Now, Uproar and Quickstride quickly react=
 as they bolt toward the Ark at full speed.  Quickstride running quite a bi=
t faster at his full gallop, than Uproar, who manages to keep up but by a s=
light distance.  With thundering hooves, the swift moving thoroughbread mak=
es it into the field of the Ark.  Uproar trails right behind him.

"We're i=
n Rodimus!"

Exclaims Quickstride as Uproar sniffs around, padding about th=
e Ark, as if smelling something strange.  He paces back and forth.

"I don'=
t like this, I'm smelling something strange, something unidentified.."

He =
points with his paw, to let Rodimus know where the scent is coming from.

"=
In there, that direction."

Quickstride sniffs as well.

"Ohh boy, ohh yeah=
, I smell it too.  Doesn't smell good at all.."

Outside the Ark, Tucson co=
uld feel the explosion, as it rocks him somewhat, almost losing stability o=
n his wheels.  He quickly rights himself with a bit of a struggle.

Inside,=
 Straight Shot and Rat Trap help to hold Talon steady.

"Woahh, wheels, are=
 ya okay?"

Tucson replies.

"Sorry about that - Rat Trap.  The explosion c=
aught me - off guard a bit."

Straight Shot frowns.

"If I were you, I'd le=
t Bantor and the others continue to towe ya back.. You still don't sound to=
o good Tucson. And don't try ta agrue with me."

Night Shift nodds.

"Yeah,=
 I'm with her, you still need help, big guy."

Tucson sighs.

"Well, I can =
 not argue with any of you. I - just don't feel it is right for you to go s=
o much out of your way for me. All of you, have worked very hard on my beha=
lf, I - do promise I will reciprocate when I am able to."

Rat Trap smiles.=


"Awwwwww, it's okay Wheels, we're your friends, and that's what friends a=
re for.  You taught us how ta follow our hearts, and how ta work with the m=
ost simplest of means.  And it worked.  Everything that's happened, even th=
e explosion, was done outa pure heart.  I dunno if I would've ever thought =
of lookn' that deep down ta find resolve.  You taught me that Wheels, and y=
a taught everyone that it's not impossible ta fight back.  But most of all,=
 ya taught ALL of us how ta believe in making things better."

Straight Sho=
t nodds.

" You've done so much for everyone all ready Tucson.  You rescued=
 Windlord, Nightlight, and Rodimus, and you won the loyalty of Perceptor.  =
And all you used was your heart."

Tucson sighs.

" I - can not ask for a b=
etter group of comrades.  What I ever wanted is right here, with - all of y=
ou.  And - if we don't always win the battle, - it - wasn't meant to be.  A=
bsolute - power can never replace what I have which I - consider most valua=
ble.  There is no price that can overshadow what we share.  And - there nev=
er will be."

He thinks for a moment.

"Something, that - Hydras nor Megatr=
on, could ever appreciate.  I - suppose that is why Hydras is never satisfi=
ed with what he has.  He - always has to have more power, more dominence, m=
ore destructive oppression.  I  will - not feed into his hunger for such th=
ings.  Tables will turn, it - will just take time, my friends... It - will =
just take time."

His engine cuts out once again. Night Shift takes up his =
harness once more.

"I knew it, good thing we're still around."

nd Quickstride wee hatching their new plan to get through the

e time continue to count down.

> As the explosion rocked the area of the=
 Black Tower, even at this distance,

ors registered a small blip, the

ick calculation gave him a true

mus said as he leaped up from their place of waiting and began to

wards the shield, he holding the device in his hand. Behind him Leo

Wing Caliber and Ramulus were quickly behind him.

dimus sent his device hurtling towards the shield as he

urry, we have only a few seconds before the shielding

de the Ark

a vigil on

 steady and 
> strong even in their sedated state =E2=80" her systems were =
stable and running 
> under their own power now.
> 
> Legacy looked up, his=
 optic sensor glowing strangely. "Facinating" he said 
> as he stood up.
> =

> "What is it?" Bump said as he looked over at Legacy, alarm creeping onto=
 his 
> face and into his voice.
> 
> "I am detecting a distant seismic dis=
turbance." Legacy said after a moment 
> of contemplation.
> 
> Santon look=
ed at Nightlight as if half expecting this to be affecting her. 
> "Where i=
s it coming from?" he said as he now turned to Legacy, for the 
> moment co=
nfident that this seemed to have no affect on their patient.

used for a moment as if examining his internal records. "Unknown"

d finally. "I would need full access to the Ark's sensors." Legacy 
> looke=
d back at Santon and Bump, "However if this is indeed a result of

tor's destruction of his former base then the exlosion was truly 
> massive=
 on a large scale."

> 
> As Legacy and the others talked, th=
e voice that was speaking to Elita 
> continued talking, "Elita. I am hurt,=
 badly hurt." It sounded like Lord 
> Elder still, but the voice was steadi=
ly getting weaker.
> 
> There was the sound of crawling and shuffling. "I w=
as ambushed and knocked

e you?"

rro, Torca, I've regained sixty percent of my energy reserve.

ssistance, and wish not to burden you any further.

vehicle my size and weight, must put quite a strain

d rather not see that happen."

"We are always here for the Maximals

ve.

> Torca and Bantor who had been the actual ones to help pull began t=
o come to 
> a slow halt. They were not fast as most vehicles go, but they =
were large 
> enough. Bantor was perhaps fully the size of a large jungle c=
at, but Torca

to pull Tuscon by

octorro, "You and Quicksilver get back to the 
> Ark. I think we have this =
under control, the Ark is the most important thing

y both said in unison as they both began flying off in the

the Ark.
